channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

  • Description: Pkg found in lined Hazmat bin, wet/ripped. Loose caps allowed liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents and carton causing the carton to rip and partially dissolve.

item.title: Report E-2024050350
item.description:
Report E-2024050350

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to crushed freight damaging one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug. Clean Harbors personnel used a neutralizer and absorbent to collect the released material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon and one (1) 30- gallon poly drums. An impacted pallet was broken down and placed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050277
item.description:
Report E-2024050277

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: MERIDEN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHR experienced a UN2014 Oxteril 34 LRA release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.25 cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the tote lid due to a broken cap caused by improper loading. The cap was replaced with a new one. The damaged cap and impacted rags used to wipe down the tote were containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024050552
item.description:
Report X-2024050552

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: HARTFORD
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING WHILE ON AN IRREG CART. TRAIN DRIVER DROVE THE TRAIN WITH CART TO THE DMP AREA. RESPONDER REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE TRAIN AND PUT IT IN A LINED SPILL TUB FOR PROCESSING.
